definition: to join hands/hand in hand
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
to pull/to play (a bowed instrument)/to drag/to draw/to chat
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: Hand in hand, have no quarrel.
sentences.chinese: 他們手拉手，不吵也不鬧。

sentences.english: They sat down, hand in hand.
sentences.chinese: 他們手拉手地坐了下來。

sentences.english: And for this, hand-in-hand will work better than fist-to-fist.
sentences.chinese: 爲此目的，手拉手比拳對拳要奏效。

sentences.english: But in days to come he will walk hand in hand with us.
sentences.chinese: 但是在未來的日子裏，他會跟我們手拉手地一起走的。

sentences.english: I remember those dark streets and walking hand in hand with my father.
sentences.chinese: 我記得那些黑暗的街道以及同父親手拉手走路的情景。

sentences.english: Celine and the girl sang one of her hit song together hand in hand , looking into each other's eyes deeply.
sentences.chinese: 席琳迪翁和女孩手拉手，共同演唱了她的一首成名曲。

sentences.english: They walked down the street hand in hand.
sentences.chinese: 他們手拉手沿街道走去。

sentences.english: Determination went hand in hand with doggedness.
sentences.chinese: 決心手拉手與頑固狀態匹配。

sentences.english: The marketing system for your MLM business works hand in hand with your MLM recruiting system.
sentences.chinese: 您傳銷業務營銷體系工程手拉手閣下傳銷招聘制。

sentences.english: These often go hand-in-hand with negativity.
sentences.chinese: 這種關係經常會與消極與手拉手相伴出現的。

sentences.english: They walked away hand in hand.
This will include management of volunteers and increasing hand-in-hand sponsorships.
sentences.chinese: 這裏包括義工的管理及手拉手助養人的推廣。

sentences.english: The partners all joined hands and danced in a big circle.
sentences.chinese: 舞伴們全都手拉手繞成一個大圈子跳舞。

definition: hand in hand
shoulder to shoulder/abreast/side by side
to hold hands
arms around each other's shoulders (idiom)
to be kind and love one another (idiom); bound by deep emotions
to stroll around the streets (esp. of a young couple)
to go with sb/to form companionships
talking and laughing/to jest/cheerful and lively
in the same place/together/with/altogether (in total)
a handle/to pull on a handle
to hold hands/to shake hands
to agree (on a meeting place, date etc)/to reach agreement/to make an appointment
to help lift up onto one's shoulders/to stand on sb's shoulder
variant of 軋馬路|轧马路[ya4 ma3 lu4]
back to back
sweethearts/lovers
to confide in each other (idiom)
